title: Pepsi Stock Could Lose Steam as Investments Soak Up Cash, Analyst Says
text:
Text size

PepsiCo stock, like many other consumer staples, has had a great year. Guggenheim doesn’t expect next week’s earnings report to do much to change that, but the firm does warn that the rally may struggle to continue in the face of increased investments.

The back story. Pepsi (ticker: PEP) is up more than 22% this year, above the Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLP) and the S&P 500, which are both up just under 20% in 2019. The company reported an upbeat quarter in July, while a generous dividend and reputation as a defensive stock have helped Pepsi sidestep much of the market turmoil stemming from tariffs and geopolitical worries.
description: Guggenheim analyst Laurent Grande reiterated a Neutral rating on Pepsi, although he raised his price target by $3, to $130.
